00043 /*****************************************************************************/
00044 /**
00045  * _errorMessageDuplicateProbeSets
00046  * Synopsis:
00047  * Helper error message convienance function to make the code easier to read.
00048  *
00049  * @param rte - RunTimeEnviornment
00050  * @param ttm - TranslationTableModel.
00051  * @param row - the row in question, 0 based.
00052  *
00053  * @return false - indicates it is not ok to perform analysis.
00054  */
00055 /*****************************************************************************/
00056 static bool _errorMessageDuplicateProbeSets(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte,
00057     TranslationTableModel & ttm,
00058     const int row)
00059 {
00060 
00061 
00062   bool okToContinue = false;
00063   std::stringstream msgSStr;
00064   msgSStr << rte.m_adtOpts.m_inputGenoFile << ": invalid ProbeSet with Allele [A1-A29] or Reference column for row: " << endl;
00065   std::string rowAsString = ttm.getRowAsString(row);
00066   msgSStr << "gene row [" << row << "]: " << rowAsString << endl;
00067   Verbose::warn(ADT_VERBOSE_EXCEPTION, msgSStr.str());
00068 
00069   return okToContinue;
00070 
00071 }
00072 // end TranslationTable::_errorMessageDuplicateProbeSets

00075 /**
00076  * _errorMessageGeneRowOrder
00077  * Synopsis:
00078  * Helper error message convienance function to make the code easier to read.
00079  *
00080  * @param rte - RunTimeEnviornment
00081  * @param ttm - TranslationTableModel.
00082  * @param row - the row in question, 0 based.
00083  *
00084  * @return false - indicates it is not ok to perform analysis.
00085  */
00086 /*****************************************************************************/
00087 static bool _errorMessageGeneRowOrder(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte,
00088     TranslationTableModel & ttm,
00089     const int row,
00090     const std::string & geneInProcess)
00091 {
00092 
00093   bool okToContinue = false;
00094   std::stringstream msgSStr;
00095   msgSStr << rte.m_adtOpts.m_inputGenoFile << ": invalid format, gene row is not under the correct gene header: " << endl;
00096   std::string rowAsString = ttm.getRowAsString(row);
00097   msgSStr << "gene row [" << row << "]: " << rowAsString << endl;
00098   msgSStr << "gene header : "  << geneInProcess ;
00099   Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_INPUT_FILES,  msgSStr.str());
00100 
00101   return okToContinue;
00102 
00103 }
00104 // end _errorMessageGeneRowOrder

00107 /**
00108  * TranslationTable::TranslationTable
00109  * Synopsis:
00110  * Main constructor.
00111  * Truth be told, this object should really be refactored to
00112  * just "Translation" and not "TranslationTable". There was a time where
00113  * object was closely coupled with the translation table but no more.
00114  *
00115  * This object is primarily comprised of a hash of gene call business objects
00116  * derived from the translation table. 
00117  * The key is the gene name. The value is a std::vector of GenCalls corresponding
00118  * to the "Reference", "Variant", and "A1" ... "AN" columns of the
00119  * translation table. Non-haplotype markers will only have GeneCalls
00120  * that correspond to the "Reference" and "Variant" columns. 
00121  * There will be a GeneCall per each non-haplotype marker plus one for the
00122  * single possible Haplotype set of markers.
00123  *
00124  * During translation, each GeneCall will be attempted to match
00125  * the CHP experiment data and if a match is find then the underlying
00126  * CallSet contained within the GeneCall will be attached to
00127  * the CallResults object. 
00128  *
00129  * 1.) GeneCall with CallSets for making translation calls. 
00130  * 2.) Zero Copy Number CallSets per gene. 
00131  *
00132  * @param rte - the single instance run time environment
00133  * @param ttm - the single instance TranslationTableModel 
00134  * @param cntm - CopyNumberTableModel which carries the override alleles.
00135  */
00136 /*****************************************************************************/
00137 TranslationTable::TranslationTable(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte,
00138                                    TranslationTableModel & ttm,
00139                                    const CopyNumberTableModel & cntm)
00140 {
00141 
00142 
00143   std::string    geneInProcess;
00144   std::string    priorGene;
00145   int       geneHeaderRow           = 0;
00146   GeneCall *nextMarkerGeneCall      = NULL;
00147   GeneCall *nextHaplotypeGeneCall   = NULL;
00148   bool      okToContinue            = true;
00149   bool      rowIsHaplotype          = false;
00150   int       haplotypeCount          = 0;
00151 
00152   //Profile profile1;
00153   int numRows = ttm.size();
00154 
00155   for (int row = 0; (row < numRows) && okToContinue ;  row++) {
00156 
00157     std::string rowAsString = ttm.getRowAsString(row);
00158 
00159     if (ttm.ignoreRow(row)) {
00160       Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_INPUT_FILES, "IGNORING: " + ToStr(row + 2) + ":" + rowAsString);
00161       continue;
00162     } else {
00163       Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_INPUT_FILES, "PROCESSING: " + ToStr(row + 2) + ":" + rowAsString);
00164     }
00165 
00166     std::string gene = ttm.m_rows[row][ttm.getColumnIndex(ADT_DMET3_TT_GENE)];
00167     std::string probeSet = ttm.m_rows[row][ttm.getColumnIndex(ADT_DMET3_TT_PROBE_SET_ID)];
00168 
00169 
00170     if (gene != geneInProcess)  {
00171       // Starting a new GENE.
00172 
00173       if (ttm.validateRowIsHeader(row)) {
00174 
00175         m_geneGroupCompleteCallSet[gene] = CallSet(gene + ":CompleteSet");
00176         priorGene = geneInProcess;
00177         geneInProcess = gene;
00178         rowIsHaplotype = false;
00179         geneHeaderRow = row;
00180         haplotypeCount = 0;
00181 
00182         if (nextHaplotypeGeneCall != NULL) {
00183           nextHaplotypeGeneCall =
00184             _addGeneCallToGroup(rte, priorGene, nextHaplotypeGeneCall);
00185 
00186         }
00187 
00188         // Copy Number is hard code for DMET2
00189         // Copy Number is data driven for DMET3
00190         if (rte.m_adtOpts.m_dmet2Calling) {
00191           if (isGeneCopyNumberSensitive(gene)) {
00192             std::map<std::string, std::string>::const_iterator itSS;
00193 
00194             for (itSS =  cntm.m_experimentCopyNumberCall.begin();
00195                  itSS !=  cntm.m_experimentCopyNumberCall.end(); itSS++) {
00196               std::string geneExperiment = gene + ":" + itSS->first;
00197               m_geneExperimentCopyNumberCall[geneExperiment] = itSS->second;
00198             }
00199           }
00200         }
00201       } else {
00202         okToContinue
00203         = _errorMessageGeneRowOrder(rte, ttm, row, geneInProcess) ;
00204       }
00205 
00206       continue;
00207 
00208     } // if starting new gene and encounted the gene header row
00209 
00210     rowIsHaplotype = ttm.isRowHaplotype(row);
00211 
00212     // We currently only support one Haplotype per gene.
00213     // The haplotype rows may be out of order so just continue to append
00214     // the current haplotype gene call.
00215     if (rowIsHaplotype && ! nextHaplotypeGeneCall) {
00216       nextHaplotypeGeneCall = new GeneCall(rte, ttm, geneHeaderRow, rowIsHaplotype);
00217     }
00218 
00219     // For multi-allelic probeSets then the nextMarkerGeneCall is the
00220     // previous version.
00221     bool okToAddMarkerGeneCall = true;
00222     if ((nextMarkerGeneCall = _findMarkerGeneCall(geneInProcess,  probeSet))  != NULL) {
00223 
00224       okToAddMarkerGeneCall = false;
00225 
00226     } else {
00227       nextMarkerGeneCall = new GeneCall(rte, ttm, geneHeaderRow, false);
00228     }
00229 
00230     bool okCallElement = true;
00231     // Add a marker GeneCall for both Haplotype and Marker.
00232     int allMarkerAlleleIndex[] = { ttm.getColumnIndex(ADT_DMET3_TT_REFERENCE), ttm.getColumnIndex(ADT_DMET3_TT_VARIANT) };
00233 
00234     // Make sure the reference and variant are not the same.
00235     std::string ref = ttm.m_rows[row][allMarkerAlleleIndex[0]];
00236     std::string var = ttm.m_rows[row][allMarkerAlleleIndex[1]];
00237 
00238     if (ref == var) {
00239       APT_ERR_ABORT(gene + " " + probeSet + ": translation file reference and variant base are identical.");
00240     }
00241     for (int i = 0; (i < 2) && okCallElement; i++) {
00242 
00243       okCallElement = okCallElement && nextMarkerGeneCall->
00244                       addCallElementToAlleleCallSet(ttm, geneHeaderRow, row, allMarkerAlleleIndex[i], true, false);
00245 
00246       m_geneGroupCompleteCallSet[gene].
00247       addCallElement(ttm, row, allMarkerAlleleIndex[i], true);
00248 
00249     }
00250 
00251     if (rowIsHaplotype) {
00252       // Add to Allele call sets
00253       std::vector<int> alleleColumns = ttm.getHaplotypeAlleleColumns(geneHeaderRow);
00254       for (int j = 0; okCallElement && (j < alleleColumns.size()); j++) {
00255         APT_ERR_ASSERT(nextHaplotypeGeneCall, "");
00256 
00257         if (ttm.m_rows[row][alleleColumns[j]].empty()) {
00258           continue;
00259         }
00260 
00261         okCallElement = okCallElement &&
00262                         nextHaplotypeGeneCall->
00263                         addCallElementToAlleleCallSet(ttm, geneHeaderRow, row, alleleColumns[j], true, true);
00264         m_geneGroupCompleteCallSet[gene].
00265         addCallElement(ttm, row, alleleColumns[j], true);
00266       }
00267     } else if ( ttm.getType() == ADT_TRANSLATION_TABLE_TYPE_DMET3 ){
00268       // For non-haplotype markers the copy number base needs to be added.
00269       int copyNumberColumn =  ttm.getCopyNumberColumn(row);
00270       if (copyNumberColumn > -1) {
00271 
00272         okCallElement = okCallElement && nextMarkerGeneCall->
00273                         addCallElementToAlleleCallSet(ttm, geneHeaderRow, row, copyNumberColumn, true, false);
00274 
00275         m_geneGroupCompleteCallSet[gene].
00276         addCallElement(ttm, row, copyNumberColumn, true);
00277 
00278       }
00279     }
00280 
00281     // Add a single marker call
00282     if (okToAddMarkerGeneCall && okCallElement) {
00283       nextMarkerGeneCall = _addGeneCallToGroup(rte, gene, nextMarkerGeneCall);
00284     } else if (!okCallElement) {
00285       okToContinue = _errorMessageDuplicateProbeSets(rte, ttm, row);
00286     }
00287 
00288   } // for each row
00289 
00290   if (okToContinue && (nextHaplotypeGeneCall != NULL)) {
00291     nextHaplotypeGeneCall =
00292       _addGeneCallToGroup(rte, geneInProcess, nextHaplotypeGeneCall);
00293 
00294   }
00295   std::map<std::string, CallSet>::iterator itSCS;
00296   itSCS = m_geneGroupCompleteCallSet.begin();
00297 
00298   for ( ; itSCS != m_geneGroupCompleteCallSet.end(); itSCS++ ) {
00299     std::map<std::string, CallElement >::iterator itCE;
00300     for (  itCE = itSCS->second.m_ceSet.begin();
00301            itCE != itSCS->second.m_ceSet.end();   itCE++ ) {
00302       itCE->second.setCompleteSetSize();
00303     }
00304   }
00305 
00306   if (ttm.getType() == ADT_TRANSLATION_TABLE_TYPE_DMET3) {
00307     okToContinue = okToContinue && _duplicateCallSetCheck(rte);
00308     okToContinue = okToContinue && _reconcileCopyNumberCallSet(rte, ttm);
00309   }
00310 
00311   if (!okToContinue) {
00312     std::stringstream msgSStr;
00313     msgSStr << rte.m_adtOpts.m_inputGenoFile ;
00314     msgSStr << ": business logic errors detected.";
00315     APT_ERR_ABORT(msgSStr.str());
00316   }
00317 
00318 
00319 }
00320 // end TranslationTable::TranslationTable
00321 /*****************************************************************************/

00323 /**
00324  * TranslationTable::getGeneCallGroup
00325  * Synopsis:
00326  *
00327  * A selector for the m_geneGroup.
00328  * 
00329  * Typically a GeneCallGroup will be made up of SNPs (single
00330  * markers) and one possilbe Haplotype CallSet. In any case, the
00331  * entire set is returned with this method. 
00332  *
00333  * @param geneName - TranslationTableModel gene.
00334  * @returns std::vector<GeneCall> - the group of GeneCalls found. a
00335  */
00336 /*****************************************************************************/
00337 std::vector<GeneCall> TranslationTable::getGeneCallGroup(const std::string & geneName)
00338 {
00339   return m_geneGroup[geneName];
00340 
00341 }
00342 // end TranslationTable::getGeneCallGroup
00343 /*****************************************************************************/
00344 /*****************************************************************************/
00345 /**
00346  * TranslationTable::hasGeneCall
00347  * Synopsis:
00348  * 
00349  * Interrogate the std::vector of GeneCalls if a particular gene name
00350  * is available for making a call. If not then there is no experiment
00351  * analysis to be done.
00352  *
00353  * @return true - if the passed in gene name has any corresponding GeneCall.
00354  */
00355 /*****************************************************************************/
00356 bool TranslationTable::hasGeneCall(const std::string & geneName)
00357 {
00358 
00359   return (m_geneGroup[geneName].size() != 0);
00360 
00361 }
00362 // end TranslationTable::hasGeneCall
00363 /*****************************************************************************/
00364 /*****************************************************************************/
00365 /**
00366  * TranslationTable::translateExperimentGene
00367  * Snyopsis:
00368  * Perform translation and invoke the translation algorithm found in the
00369  * GeneCall business object.
00370  * Marshalls all the requisite data for making each translation
00371  * call and then again packages up the results in the CallResults
00372  * business object whenever a call is made.
00373  * 
00374  * To re-state this routine is mostly
00375  * just a wrapper around the GeneCall method of similar name,
00376  * translateExperimentCall. The difference being is that this
00377  * method iterates over all the GeneCall's in a group and summarizes
00378  * the results in the return ExperimentGeneResults.
00379  *
00380  * So the way  this works is that each GeneCall acts as a filter on the
00381  * input genotype experiment data. Genotype data is grouped into genes within
00382  * the GenotypeTableModel being passed in. Each GeneCall corresponds to
00383  * precisely one gene marker or probe set, or the gene's
00384  * single Haplotype marker
00385  * set. The input genotype data (CHP) represented by the
00386  * GenotypeTableModel is searched for the probe sets required for
00387  * GeneCall. The two chromatid CallSets are built from the
00388  * GenotypTableModel for the GeneCall in question and then the
00389  * translation algorithm is invoked to find a match.
00390  *
00391  * If the input genotype data (CHP) does not contain the probe sets
00392  * required for the GeneCall in question then the GeneCall is skipped.
00393  * There is an exception with respect to the Haplotype set of markers.
00394  * If the program option is given to enforce that entire Haplotype
00395  * sets be complete for translation and markers are found missing
00396  * within the input genotype data (CHP), then an exception will be thrown.
00397  *
00398  * In the common case, an incomplete haplotype group results in the
00399  * haplotype GeneCall being skipped, but realize that each individual
00400  * marker has an individual marker GeneCall and so will still have its
00401  * marker "Ref/Var" call made. 
00402  * 
00403  * 
00404  * 
00405  * @param rte - the single instance run time environment
00406  * @param gtm - the experiment Genotype Tabel model filtered for a single gene. 
00407  * @param ttm - the single instance translation table model. 
00408  * @param cntm - DMET2 ONLY: the copy number table model
00409  * @param egr - the experiment gene results for return
00410  *
00411  * @return - egr, experiment gene results is filled in with the calls for the entire experiment gene. 
00412 
00413  */
00414 /*****************************************************************************/
00415 void TranslationTable::translateExperimentGene(RunTimeEnvironment & rte,  GenotypeTableModel  & gtm, const TranslationTableModel &ttm, const CopyNumberTableModel & cntm, ExperimentGeneResults *egr)
00416 {
00417 
00418   // Copy the static stuff from the model.
00419 
00420   APT_ERR_ASSERT(egr, "");
00421 
00422   if (! hasGeneCall(gtm.m_geneName)) {
00423 
00424     // This data should be passed through for reporting purposes.
00425     Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_TMI, "Experiment Gene with no call, ignoring: " + gtm.m_experimentName + ", " + gtm.m_geneName);
00426     return;
00427   }
00428 
00429   // Each CallSet will have a pair of CallElements corresponding to a
00430   // ALLELE1 and ALLELE2 for the row.
00431   if (rte.m_adtOpts.m_profile) {
00432     rte.m_profiles["call_loop1"]->begin();
00433   }
00434 
00435   std::vector<CallSet> invalidGTMRows = _invalidateExperimentGeneProbeSetBaseValues(rte, gtm, ttm);
00436 
00437   if (invalidGTMRows.size() > 0) {
00438     Verbose::warn(ADT_VERBOSE_NORMAL, gtm.m_geneName + ": Invalid gene markers not found in translation file");
00439     for (int i = 0; i < invalidGTMRows.size(); i++) {
00440       invalidGTMRows[i].describeVerbose(ADT_VERBOSE_NORMAL);
00441     }
00442     APT_ERR_ABORT("Invalid experiment gene marker values detected.");
00443   }
00444   if (rte.m_adtOpts.m_profile) {
00445     rte.m_profiles["call_loop1"]->end();
00446   }
00447 
00448   std::string geneExperiment = gtm.getGeneName() + ":" + gtm.m_experimentName;
00449   std::string dmet2CopyNumberCall;
00450 
00451   if (rte.m_adtOpts.m_dmet2Calling) {
00452     std::map<std::string, std::string>::const_iterator itSS
00453     = m_geneExperimentCopyNumberCall.find(geneExperiment);
00454 
00455     if (itSS != m_geneExperimentCopyNumberCall.end()) {
00456       dmet2CopyNumberCall = itSS->second;
00457     }
00458   }
00459 
00460   // This is a std::vector because a GeneCall represents one Haplotype grouping
00461   // call and many marker calls.
00462 
00463   std::vector<GeneCall> geneCallToMatch = getGeneCallGroup(gtm.getGeneName());
00464 
00465   std::vector<GeneCall>::iterator matchCall;
00466 
00467   for (matchCall = geneCallToMatch.begin();
00468        matchCall != geneCallToMatch.end(); matchCall++) {
00469 
00470     Verbose::out(ADT_VERBOSE_CALL, "CALL: " + gtm.m_geneName);
00471 
00472     //matchCall->describeVerbose( rte, ADT_VERBOSE_CALL );
00473 
00474     // Ok, the gtm will contain all the
00475     //  markers needed for all GeneCalls
00476     // This constructer filters the gtm with only elements found in the
00477     // referenceSet
00478     if (rte.m_adtOpts.m_profile) {
00479       rte.m_profiles["call_loop2"]->begin();
00480     }
00481     CallSet chromatid1(rte, gtm, matchCall->getReferenceCallSet(), 1);
00482 
00483     CallSet chromatid2(rte, gtm, matchCall->getReferenceCallSet(), 2);
00484 
00485     if (rte.m_adtOpts.m_profile) {
00486       rte.m_profiles["call_loop2"]->end();
00487     }
00488 
00489     if (chromatid1.isEmpty()) {
00490       // This experiment didn't contain any data for this call,
00491       // this is expected, just continue.
00492       continue;
00493     }
00494 
00495     if (rte.m_adtOpts.m_profile) {
00496       rte.m_profiles["call_loop3"]->begin();
00497     }
00498     CallResults call =
00499       matchCall->
00500       translateExperimentCall(rte,
00501                               m_geneGroupCompleteCallSet[gtm.m_geneName],
00502                               gtm,
00503                               chromatid1, chromatid2,
00504                               dmet2CopyNumberCall,
00505                               m_geneCopyNumberZeroCallSet[gtm.m_geneName]);
00506 
00507     if (rte.m_adtOpts.m_profile) {
00508       rte.m_profiles["call_loop3"]->end();
00509     }
00510 
00511     // Set the TranslatedExperimentResults data
00512     egr->appendCallResults(call, *matchCall);
00513 
00514   } // for each experiment gene call
00515 
00516 
00517   return;
00518 }
00519 // end   TranslationTable::translateExperimentGene
00520 /*****************************************************************************/
00521 /*****************************************************************************/
00522 /**
00523  * TranslationTable::_addGeneCallToGroup
00524  * Synopsis:
00525  * Helper function for the constructor, TranslationTable::TranslationTable
00526  * 
00527  * Add a completed GeneCall to a gene's call Group.
00528  *
00529  * @param rte - RunTimeEnvironment
00530  * @param gene - std::string name of the Gene from the translation table.
00531  * @param addGeneCall - pointer to the GeneCall to add
00532  * @param markerProbeSet - 
00533  *
00534  * @returns NULL, to reset a the pointer if needed.
00535  */
00536 /*****************************************************************************/
00537 GeneCall * TranslationTable::_addGeneCallToGroup(
00538   const RunTimeEnvironment & rte,
00539   const std::string & gene,
00540   GeneCall * addGeneCall)
00541 {
00542 
00543   APT_ERR_ASSERT(addGeneCall, "");
00544 
00545   if (addGeneCall->getReferenceCallSet().getCallType() == ADT_CALL_TYPE_HAPLOTYPE_GROUP) {
00546     _completeAlleleSets(addGeneCall);
00547   } else {
00548     // Erase the allele name CallSets for MARKERS.
00549     // The first two CallSets are always Reference and Variant.
00550     // The copy number 0 set will be reconciled in another API.
00551     for (int i = addGeneCall->m_alleleSet.size() - 1; i >= 2; i--) {
00552       if (addGeneCall->m_alleleSet[i].m_copyNumber != 0) {
00553         addGeneCall->m_alleleSet.erase(addGeneCall->m_alleleSet.begin() + i);
00554       }
00555     }
00556   }
00557 
00558   m_geneGroup[gene].push_back(*addGeneCall);
00559 
00560   //m_geneGroup[gene][m_geneGroup[gene].size() -1].describeVerbose(rte, ADT_VERBOSE_NORMAL);
00561 
00562   delete addGeneCall;
00563 
00564   return  NULL;
00565 
00566 }
00567 // end TranslationTable::_addGeneCallToGroup
00568 /*****************************************************************************/
00569 /*****************************************************************************/
00570 /**
00571  * TranslationTable::_completeAlleleSets
00572  * Synopsis:
00573  * Helper function to TranslationTable::_addGeneCallToGroup
00574  * 
00575  * The allele bases  in the input translation table represent
00576  * changes with respect to the reference set. Fill in the blanks where the
00577  * reference set ProbeSet bases are added when not found in the allele set.
00578  * For SNP markers this means filling in the reference value for the
00579  * first column which matches the reference.
00580  *
00581  * @param  gc - pointer to the GeneCall class in question.
00582  *
00583  */
00584 /*****************************************************************************/
00585 void TranslationTable::_completeAlleleSets(GeneCall * gc)
00586 {
00587 
00588   APT_ERR_ASSERT(gc, "");
00589 
00590   CallSet & referenceSet = gc->getReferenceCallSet();
00591 
00592   std::map<std::string, CallElement>::iterator iCEit;
00593 
00594 
00595   for (int i = 0; i < gc->m_alleleSet.size(); i++) {
00596 
00597     CallSet & alleleSet = gc->getAlleleCallSet(i);
00598 
00599     alleleSet.m_type = ADT_CALL_TYPE_HAPLOTYPE_GROUP;
00600     alleleSet.m_isDescriptive = true;
00601 
00602     // For each CallElement in the reference set,
00603     // search for the ProbeSet in the allele set and if
00604     // it is not there, then add the reference CallElement to the allele set.
00605     for (iCEit = referenceSet.m_ceSet.begin();
00606          iCEit != referenceSet.m_ceSet.end();
00607          iCEit++) {
00608 
00609       std::map<std::string, CallElement>::iterator jCEit;
00610       bool okToAdd = true;
00611 
00612       for (jCEit = alleleSet.m_ceSet.begin();
00613            (jCEit != alleleSet.m_ceSet.end()) &&
00614            okToAdd;
00615            jCEit++) {
00616 
00617         if (jCEit->first == iCEit->first)
00618           okToAdd = false;
00619 
00620 
00621       } // for each CallElement in the alleleSet, find the corresponding
00622       // CallElement probeSet in the referenceSet.
00623 
00624       if (okToAdd) {
00625         alleleSet.m_ceSet[iCEit->first] = iCEit->second;
00626       }
00627 
00628     } // for each CallElement in the referenceSet
00629 
00630 
00631   } // for each allele call, complete the allele set
00632 
00633 
00634   return;
00635 
00636 }
00637 // end TranslationTable::_completeAlleleSets
00638 /*****************************************************************************/
00639 /*****************************************************************************/
00640 /**
00641  * TranslationTable::_duplicateCallSetCheck
00642  * Synopsis:
00643  * Helper function to the constructor, TranslationTable::TranslationTable
00644  *
00645  * The input translation table is created by humans and is
00646  * not guaranteed to have a unique set of
00647  * defining markers per haplotype alllele. The algorithm 
00648  * behavior during translation is to match the first
00649  * allele set of defining markers and ignore the others.
00650  * This API is used to make the determinate if any duplicates
00651  * exist and the calllee can use this to abort the program or
00652  * not depending on the business requirements. 
00653  * 
00654  *
00655  * @param rte  - the single run time environment instance
00656  * 
00657  * @returns true - the duplicates do not exist 
00658  */
00659 /*****************************************************************************/
00660 bool TranslationTable::_duplicateCallSetCheck(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte)
00661 {
00662 
00663   std::map<std::string, std::vector<GeneCall> >::iterator itMSVG;
00664 
00665   ADT_VERBOSE_ENUM level = ADT_VERBOSE_NORMAL;
00666 
00667   bool okDuplicateCheck = true;
00668 
00669   // Foreach gene
00670   for (itMSVG = m_geneGroup.begin(); itMSVG != m_geneGroup.end(); itMSVG++) {
00671 
00672     std::string gene = itMSVG->first;
00673 
00674     // Foreach GeneCall allele call set
00675     for (int i = 0; i < itMSVG->second.size(); i++) {
00676 
00677       // Foreach call set
00678       for (int j = 1; j < itMSVG->second[i].m_alleleSet.size(); j++) {
00679 
00680         // Check subsequent call sets for duplicates.
00681 
00682         for (int k = j + 1; k < itMSVG->second[i].m_alleleSet.size(); k++) {
00683 
00684           if (!rte.m_adtOpts.m_audit.empty() && itMSVG->second[i].m_alleleSet[j] == itMSVG->second[i].m_alleleSet[k]) {
00685             Verbose::warn(level, "Invalid translation table, duplicate allele set of variants detected.");
00686             itMSVG->second[i].m_alleleSet[j].describeVerbose(level);
00687             itMSVG->second[i].m_alleleSet[k].describeVerbose(level);
00688             //Verbose::warn(level, "Translation file, duplicate allele set of variants detected.");
00689             okDuplicateCheck = false;;
00690           }
00691         }
00692       }
00693     }
00694   }
00695 
00696 
00697   return okDuplicateCheck;
00698 }
00699 // end TranslationTable::_duplicateCallSetCheck
00700 /*****************************************************************************/
00701 /**
00702  * TranslationTable::_findMarkerGeneCall
00703  * Synopsis:
00704  * Helper function to the constructor, TranslationTable::TranslationTable
00705  *
00706  * When constructing marker GeneCalls, each marker gets a new GeneCall
00707  * except for multiallelic markers. These markers will already have GeneCalls
00708  * in the m_geneGroup when the marker occurs for more than once in the
00709  * input translation table. 
00710  * This method finds the appropriate GeneCall for the multiallelic  marker
00711  * that already has a GeneCall. 
00712  * 
00713  *
00714  * @param gene - the multiallelic probeSet
00715  * @param probeSet - the marker
00716  * 
00717  * @return - The corresponding GeneCall for the inputs.
00718  */
00719 /*****************************************************************************/
00720 GeneCall * TranslationTable::_findMarkerGeneCall(std::string gene, std::string probeSet)
00721 {
00722 
00723   if (! m_geneGroupCompleteCallSet[gene].hasProbeSet(probeSet)) {
00724     return NULL;
00725   }
00726 
00727   for (int i = 0; i < m_geneGroup[gene].size(); i++) {
00728 
00729     for (int j = 0; j < m_geneGroup[gene][i].m_alleleSet.size(); j++) {
00730       if (m_geneGroup[gene][i].m_alleleSet[j].hasProbeSet(probeSet) &&
00731           m_geneGroup[gene][i].m_alleleSet[j].getCallType() == ADT_CALL_TYPE_MARKER) {
00732         return &(m_geneGroup[gene][i]);
00733       }
00734     }
00735   }
00736   // Programming error. The complete set cannot have an probeSet that
00737   // is not in a GeneCall.
00738 
00739   APT_ERR_ASSERT(false, "");
00740 
00741   return NULL;
00742 
00743 }
00744 // end TranslationTable::_findMarkerGeneCall
00745 /*****************************************************************************/
00746 /*****************************************************************************/
00747 /**
00748  * TranslationTable::_invalidateExperimentGeneProbeSetBaseValues
00749  * Synopsis:
00750  * Helper function to TranslationTable::translateExperimentGene
00751  * 
00752  * This is just and optimiaztion fucntion where the *MAJORITY* 
00753  * of inbound GenotypeTableModel probe sets will have ProbeSet/Base pairs which
00754  * are not recognized for any GeneCall. This helper method modifies
00755  * the passed in GenotypeTableModel by marking rows in the
00756  * "m_rows" attribute that are unknown with a special experiment name.
00757  * The invalid rows are also returned
00758  * in the form of a CallSet where each ALLELE1 and ALLELE2
00759  * CallElement corresponds to one CallSet and one GTM row.
00760  *
00761  * @param rte - the single instance RunTimeEnvironment
00762  * @param gtm - a GenotypeTableModel for a particulare gene experiment.
00763  * @param ttm - the single instance translation table model
00764  *
00765  * @return invalidRows - a std::vector<CallSet> where each CallSet represents a
00766  *                       row where ALLELE1 or ALLELE2 had an invalid base.
00767  */
00768 /*****************************************************************************/
00769 std::vector<CallSet> TranslationTable::_invalidateExperimentGeneProbeSetBaseValues(
00770   const RunTimeEnvironment & rte, GenotypeTableModel & gtm, const TranslationTableModel & ttm)
00771 {
00772 
00773 
00774   std::vector<CallSet> invalidGTMRows;
00775 
00776   // Unknown gene names should be handled before calling this API.
00777 
00778   APT_ERR_ASSERT(m_geneGroupCompleteCallSet.find(gtm.getGeneName()) != m_geneGroupCompleteCallSet.end(), "");
00779 
00780 
00781   const CallSet & testCS = m_geneGroupCompleteCallSet[gtm.getGeneName()];
00782 
00783   for (int i = 0; i < gtm.getGeneRowSize(gtm.getGeneName()); i++) {
00784 
00785     int row = gtm.getGeneRow(gtm.getGeneName(), i);
00786 
00787     std::string probeSet = gtm.m_rows[row][GT_PROBE_SET_INDEX];
00788     std::string geneName = gtm.m_rows[row][GT_GENES_INDEX];
00789     std::string base1    = gtm.m_rows[row][GT_ALLELE1_INDEX];
00790     std::string base2    = gtm.m_rows[row][GT_ALLELE2_INDEX];
00791 
00792     if (base2.empty()) {
00793       base2 = base1;
00794     }
00795 
00796     CallElement allele1(probeSet, base1);
00797     CallElement allele2(probeSet, base2);
00798 
00799     if (testCS.hasProbeSet(probeSet)) {
00800 
00801       // Non-haplotype markers are always valid.
00802       if (ttm.isHaplotypeMarker(probeSet)) {
00803 
00804 
00805         // Wildcard markers are always valid.
00806         if ((! allele1.hasWildCards() && !testCS.contains(allele1)) ||
00807             (! allele2.hasWildCards() && !testCS.contains(allele2))) {
00808 
00809           // Just ignore the row by setting the Experiment Name to something diffferent.
00810           gtm.m_rows[row][GT_EXPERIMENT_INDEX] =
00811             "Invalid ALLELE Base For ProbeSet";
00812           //Flag an exception by returning an invalid CallSEt.
00813           CallSet invalidCS(geneName);
00814           invalidCS.m_ceSet[probeSet] =  allele1 ;
00815           invalidGTMRows.push_back(invalidCS);
00816         }
00817       }
00818     } else {
00819 
00820       APT_ERR_ASSERT(ttm.m_probeSetRowIndex.count(probeSet) == 0, "");
00821       // Just ignore the row by setting the Experiment Name to something diffferent.
00822       gtm.m_rows[row][GT_EXPERIMENT_INDEX] =
00823         "Invalid ProbeSet for Gene";
00824     }
00825 
00826   }
00827 
00828   return invalidGTMRows;
00829 
00830 }
00831 // end TranslationTable::_invalidateExperimentGeneProbeSetBaseValues
00832 /*****************************************************************************/
00833 /*****************************************************************************/
00834 /**
00835  * TranslationTable::_reconcileCopyNumberCallSet:
00836  * Synopsis:
00837  * Helper function to the constructor, TranslationTable::TranslationTable.
00838  *
00839  * The format of the translation table was hacked to use an allele column
00840  * (A1-AN) to carry the copy number zero designation. This routines
00841  * reconciles the hack and creates the appropriate business object
00842  * and then marks "allele" column as one to be ignored. 
00843  *
00844  * How to know if an allele name is copy number zero?
00845  * There is no naming conention, instead the first row after the allele
00846  * name column is checked for a "0" value. If the row immediately below
00847  * the allele name contains a "0" then the allele is the single
00848  * copy number zero designation. 
00849  *
00850  * 1.) It is an exception to have more than one copy number 0 call set.
00851  * 2.) Remove the copy number 0 allele call set from the GeneCall set.
00852  * 3.) Instantiate the copy number 0 member CallSet set for the GeneCall.
00853  *
00854  * @params rte - the RunTimeEnvironment
00855  @ @params ttm - the translation table model for updates.
00856  *
00857  * @return - false on error, the parent is responsible for throwing an exception.
00858  *           ttm is updated to comment out the copy number allele
00859  *           designations.
00860  */
00861 /*****************************************************************************/
00862 bool TranslationTable::_reconcileCopyNumberCallSet(const RunTimeEnvironment & rte, TranslationTableModel & ttm)
00863 {
00864 
00865   std::map<std::string, std::vector<GeneCall> >::iterator itMSVG;
00866 
00867   // Foreach gene
00868   for (itMSVG = m_geneGroup.begin(); itMSVG != m_geneGroup.end(); itMSVG++) {
00869 
00870     std::string gene = itMSVG->first;
00871 
00872     // Foreach GeneCall allele call set
00873     for (int i = 0; i < itMSVG->second.size(); i++) {
00874 
00875 
00876       // Skip over reference and variant sets, start at 2.
00877       for (int j = 2; j < itMSVG->second[i].m_alleleSet.size(); j++) {
00878 
00879         if (itMSVG->second[i].m_alleleSet[j].m_copyNumber == 0) {
00880 
00881           // Multiple check
00882           if (m_geneCopyNumberZeroCallSet[gene].getCallType() != ADT_CALL_TYPE_NULL) {
00883             if (m_geneCopyNumberZeroCallSet[gene].m_name == itMSVG->second[i].m_alleleSet[j].m_name) {
00884               continue;
00885             }
00886             Verbose::warn(ADT_VERBOSE_EXCEPTION, "Fatal error,  translation file has more than one copy number 0 designation for gene: " + itMSVG->first + ": " +  m_geneCopyNumberZeroCallSet[gene].m_name + ", "  + itMSVG->second[i].m_alleleSet[j].m_name);
00887             return false;
00888           }
00889           ttm.m_geneCopyNumberIndicator[gene] = true;
00890           m_geneCopyNumberZeroCallSet[gene] = itMSVG->second[i].m_alleleSet[j];
00891           m_geneCopyNumberZeroCallSet[gene].m_type = ADT_CALL_TYPE_COPY_NUMBER;
00892           m_geneCopyNumberZeroCallSet[gene].size() > 1 ?
00893           m_geneCopyNumberZeroCallSet[gene].m_type = ADT_CALL_TYPE_HAPLOTYPE_GROUP :
00894               m_geneCopyNumberZeroCallSet[gene].m_type = ADT_CALL_TYPE_MARKER ;
00895           itMSVG->second[i].m_alleleSet.erase(itMSVG->second[i].m_alleleSet.begin() + j);
00896           //m_geneCopyNumberZeroCallSet[gene].describeVerbose( ADT_VERBOSE_NORMAL );
00897           // Delete the copy number 0 so that reporting doesn't
00898           // use it in relevant alleles.
00899           std::map<std::string, CallElement >::iterator itMSCE = m_geneCopyNumberZeroCallSet[gene].m_ceSet.begin();
00900           std::string probeSet = itMSCE->second.m_probeSet;
00901           int probeSetRow = ttm.getProbeSetRowIndex(probeSet);
00902           int headerRow = ttm.getHeaderRow(probeSetRow);
00903 
00904           for (int k = ttm.getColumnIndex(ADT_DMET3_TT_ALLELE_START); i < ttm.columnCount(); k++) {
00905 
00906             if (ttm.m_rows[headerRow][k] == m_geneCopyNumberZeroCallSet[gene].m_name) {
00907               //ttm.m_rows[probeSetRow][k] = "#" + m_geneCopyNumberZeroCallSet[gene].m_name;
00908               ttm.m_rows[probeSetRow][k].clear();
00909               ttm.m_rows[headerRow][k].clear();
00910               break;
00911             }
00912           }
00913         } else if (itMSVG->second[i].m_alleleSet[j].getCallType() == ADT_CALL_TYPE_MARKER) {
00914           APT_ERR_ASSERT(itMSVG->second[i].m_alleleSet.size() == 2, "");
00915         }
00916       }
00917     }
00918 
00919   }
00920 
00921   return true;
00922 }
00923 // TranslationTable::_reconcileCopyNumberCallSet
00924 /*****************************************************************************/
Generated on Tue Jul 15 2014 10:37:48 for Affymetrix Power Tools by  1.7.1
